configure scripts and rakefiles or mkrf_conf files.
Gem::Installer#build_extensions.name: build_extensions

Gem::Installer#check_executable_overwrit.description:
Checks if +filename+ exists in +@bin_dir+.

If +@force+ is set +filename+ is overwritten.

If +filename+ exists and is a RubyGems wrapper for different gem the user
is consulted.

If +filename+ exists and +@bin_dir+ is Gem.default_bindir (/usr/local) the
user is consulted.

Otherwise +filename+ is overwritten.
Gem::Installer#check_executable_overwrit.name: check_executable_overwrite

Gem::Installer#initialize.description:
Constructs an Installer instance that will install the gem located at
+gem+.  +options+ is a Hash with the following keys:

:bin_dir:: Where to put a bin wrapper if needed.
:development:: Whether or not development dependencies should be installed.
:env_shebang:: Use /usr/bin/env in bin wrappers.
:force:: Overrides all version checks and security policy checks, except
         for a signed-gems-only policy.
:format_executable:: Format the executable the same as the Ruby executable.
                     If your Ruby is ruby18, foo_exec will be installed as
                     foo_exec18.
:ignore_dependencies:: Don't raise if a dependency is missing.
:install_dir:: The directory to install the gem into.
:security_policy:: Use the specified security policy.  See Gem::Security
:user_install:: Indicate that the gem should be unpacked into the users
                personal gem directory.
:only_install_dir:: Only validate dependencies against what is in the
                    install_dir
:wrappers:: Install wrappers if true, symlinks if false.
:build_args:: An Array of arguments to pass to the extension builder
              process. If not set, then Gem::Command.build_args is used
Gem::Installer#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Installer#install.description:
Installs the gem and returns a loaded Gem::Specification for the installed
gem.

The gem will be installed with the following structure:

  @gem_home/
    cache/<gem-version>.gem #=> a cached copy of the installed gem
    gems/<gem-version>/... #=> extracted files
    specifications/<gem-version>.gemspec #=> the Gem::Specification
Gem::Installer#install.name: install

Gem::Installer#installation_satisfies_de.description: True if the gems in the system satisfy +dependency+.

Gem::Installer#options.name: options

Gem::Installer#pre_install_checks.description:
Performs various checks before installing the gem such as the install
repository is writable and its directories exist, required Ruby and
rubygems versions are met and that dependencies are installed.

Version and dependency checks are skipped if this install is forced.

The dependent check will be skipped this install is ignoring dependencies.
Gem::Installer#pre_install_checks.name: pre_install_checks

Gem::Installer#shebang.description:
Generates a #! line for +bin_file_name+'s wrapper copying arguments if
necessary.

If the :custom_shebang config is set, then it is used as a template
for how to create the shebang used for to run a gem's executables.

The template supports 4 expansions:

 $env    the path to the unix env utility
 $ruby   the path to the currently running ruby interpreter
 $exec   the path to the gem's executable
 $name   the name of the gem the executable is for
Gem::Installer#shebang.name: shebang

Gem::Package::DigestIO#write.name: write

Gem::Package::DigestIO.wrap.description:
Wraps +io+ and updates digest for each of the digest algorithms in
the +digests+ Hash.  Returns the digests hash.  Example:

  io = StringIO.new
  digests = {
    'SHA1'   => OpenSSL::Digest.new('SHA1'),
    'SHA512' => OpenSSL::Digest.new('SHA512'),
  }

  Gem::Package::DigestIO.wrap io, digests do |digest_io|
    digest_io.write "hello"
  end

  digests['SHA1'].hexdigest   #=> "aaf4c61d[...]"
  digests['SHA512'].hexdigest #=> "9b71d224[...]"
Gem::Package::DigestIO.wrap.name: wrap

Gem::Package::TarHeader.description:
--
struct tarfile_entry_posix {
  char name[100];     # ASCII + (Z unless filled)
  char mode[8];       # 0 padded, octal, null
  char uid[8];        # ditto
  char gid[8];        # ditto
  char size[12];      # 0 padded, octal, null
  char mtime[12];     # 0 padded, octal, null
  char checksum[8];   # 0 padded, octal, null, space
  char typeflag[1];   # file: "0"  dir: "5"
  char linkname[100]; # ASCII + (Z unless filled)
  char magic[6];      # "ustar\0"
  char version[2];    # "00"
  char uname[32];     # ASCIIZ
  char gname[32];     # ASCIIZ
  char devmajor[8];   # 0 padded, octal, null
  char devminor[8];   # o padded, octal, null
  char prefix[155];   # ASCII + (Z unless filled)
};
++
A header for a tar file
Gem::Package::TarHeader.name: TarHeader

Gem::Package::TarWriter#add_file_digest.description:
Adds +name+ with permissions +mode+ to the tar, yielding +io+ for writing
the file.  The +digest_algorithm+ is written to a read-only +name+.sum
file following the given file contents containing the digest name and
hexdigest separated by a tab.

The created digest object is returned.

Gem::Package::TarWriter#add_file_signed.description:
Adds +name+ with permissions +mode+ to the tar, yielding +io+ for writing
the file.  The +signer+ is used to add a digest file using its
digest_algorithm per add_file_digest and a cryptographic signature in
+name+.sig.  If the signer has no key only the checksum file is added.

Returns the digest.
Gem::Package::TarWriter#add_file_signed.name: add_file_signed

Gem::Package::TarWriter#add_file_simple.description:

Gem::PackageTask.description: Create a package based upon a Gem::Specification. Gem packages, as well as zip files and tar/gzipped packages can be produced by this task. In addition to the Rake targets generated by Rake::PackageTask, a Gem::PackageTask will also generate the following tasks: ["package_dir/name-version.gem"] Create a RubyGems package with the given name and version. Example using a Gem::Specification: require 'rubygems' require 'rubygems/package_task' spec = Gem::Specification.new do |s| s.summary = "Ruby based make-like utility." s.name = 'rake' s.version = PKG_VERSION s.requirements << 'none' s.files = PKG_FILES s.description = <<-EOF Rake is a Make-like program implemented in Ruby. Tasks and dependencies are specified in standard Ruby syntax. EOF end Gem::PackageTask.new(spec) do |pkg| pkg.need_zip = true pkg.need_tar = true end
Gem::PackageTask.name: PackageTask

Gem::Platform.description:
Available list of platforms for targeting Gem installations.

See `gem help platform` for information on platform matching.
Gem::Platform.name: Platform

Gem::Platform#==.description:
Is +other+ equal to this platform?  Two platforms are equal if they have
the same CPU, OS and version.
Gem::Platform#==.name: eql?

Gem::Platform#eql?.description:
Is +other+ equal to this platform?  Two platforms are equal if they have
the same CPU, OS and version.
Gem::Platform#eql?.name: eql?

Gem::Platform#===.description:
Does +other+ match this platform?  Two platforms match if they have the
same CPU, or either has a CPU of 'universal', they have the same OS, and
they have the same version, or either has no version.

Additionally, the platform will match if the local CPU is 'arm' and the
other CPU starts with "arm" (for generic ARM family support).

Gem::Platform#=~.description:
Does +other+ match this platform?  If +other+ is a String it will be
converted to a Gem::Platform first.  See #=== for matching rules.

Gem::Platform#cpu.description: Returns the value of attribute cpu

Gem::Platform#os.description: Returns the value of attribute os

Gem::Platform#version.description: Returns the value of attribute version

parameters: the value to set the attribute version to.

Generated when trying to lookup a gem to indicate that the gem

fetch and install read these and report them to the user to aid
in figuring out why a gem couldn't be installed.
Gem::PlatformMismatch.name: PlatformMismatch

append a platform to the list of mismatched platforms.

Platforms are added via this instead of injected via the constructor

It works for RDoc 1.0.1 (in Ruby 1.8) up to RDoc 3.6.

This implementation is considered obsolete.  The RDoc project is the
appropriate location to find this functionality.  This file provides the
hooks to load RDoc generation code from the "rdoc" gem and a fallback in
case the installed version of RDoc does not have them.

Gem::RequestSet.description:
A RequestSet groups a request to activate a set of dependencies.

  nokogiri = Gem::Dependency.new 'nokogiri', '~> 1.6'
  pg = Gem::Dependency.new 'pg', '~> 0.14'

  set = Gem::RequestSet.new nokogiri, pg

  requests = set.resolve

  p requests.map { |r| r.full_name }
  #=> ["nokogiri-1.6.0", "mini_portile-0.5.1", "pg-0.17.0"]
Gem::RequestSet.name: RequestSet

Creates a RequestSet for a list of Gem::Dependency objects, +deps+.  You

  nokogiri = Gem::Dependency.new 'nokogiri', '~> 1.6'

  set = Gem::RequestSet.new nokogiri, pg

Gem::RequestSet#install.description:
Installs gems for this RequestSet using the Gem::Installer +options+.

If a +block+ is given an activation +request+ and +installer+ are yielded.
The +installer+ will be +nil+ if a gem matching the request was already
installed.

Installs from the gem dependencies files in the +:gemdeps+ option in
+options+, yielding to the +block+ as in #install.

If +:without_groups+ is given in the +options+, those groups in the gem
dependencies file are not used.  See Gem::Installer for other +options+.
Gem::RequestSet#install_from_gemdeps.name: install_from_gemdeps

Gem::RequestSet#remote.name: remote

Gem::RequestSet#remote=.description: When false no remote sets are used for resolving gems.

Resolve the requested dependencies and return an Array of Specification
objects to be activated.

Gem::RequestSet::GemDepedencyAPI.name: GemDepedencyAPI

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI.description:
A semi-compatible DSL for the Bundler Gemfile and Isolate gem dependencies
files.

To work with both the Bundler Gemfile and Isolate formats this
implementation takes some liberties to allow compatibility with each, most
notably in #source.

A basic gem dependencies file will look like the following:

  source 'https://rubygems.org'

  gem 'rails', '3.2.14a
  gem 'devise', '~> 2.1', '>= 2.1.3'
  gem 'cancan'
  gem 'airbrake'
  gem 'pg'

RubyGems recommends saving this as gem.deps.rb over Gemfile or Isolate.

To install the gems in this Gemfile use `gem install -g` to install it and
create a lockfile.  The lockfile will ensure that when you make changes to
your gem dependencies file a minimum amount of change is made to the
dependencies of your gems.

RubyGems can activate all the gems in your dependencies file at startup
using the RUBYGEMS_GEMDEPS environment variable or through Gem.use_gemdeps.
See Gem.use_gemdeps for details and warnings.

See `gem help install` and `gem help gem_dependencies` for further details.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI.name: GemDependencyAPI

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#add_de.description:
Adds +dependencies+ to the request set if any of the +groups+ are allowed.
This is used for gemspec dependencies.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#add_de.name: add_dependencies

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#depend.description: The gems required by #gem statements in the gem.deps.rb file
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#depend.name: dependencies

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#find_g.description: Finds a gemspec with the given +name+ that lives at +path+.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#find_g.name: find_gemspec

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem.description:
:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

:call-seq:
  gem(name)
  gem(name, *requirements)
  gem(name, *requirements, options)

Specifies a gem dependency with the given +name+ and +requirements+.  You
may also supply +options+ following the +requirements+

+options+ include:

require: ::
  RubyGems does not provide any autorequire features so requires in a gem
  dependencies file are recorded but ignored.

  In bundler the require: option overrides the file to require during
  Bundler.require.  By default the name of the dependency is required in
  Bundler.  A single file or an Array of files may be given.

  To disable requiring any file give +false+:

    gem 'rake', require: false

group: ::
  Place the dependencies in the given dependency group.  A single group or
  an Array of groups may be given.

  See also #group

platform: ::
  Only install the dependency on the given platform.  A single platform or
  an Array of platforms may be given.

  See #platform for a list of platforms available.

path: ::
  Install this dependency from an unpacked gem in the given directory.

    gem 'modified_gem', path: 'vendor/modified_gem'

git: ::
  Install this dependency from a git repository:

    gem 'private_gem', git: git@my.company.example:private_gem.git'

gist: ::
  Install this dependency from the gist ID:

    gem 'bang', gist: '1232884'

github: ::
  Install this dependency from a github git repository:

    gem 'private_gem', github: 'my_company/private_gem'

submodules: ::
  Set to +true+ to include submodules when fetching the git repository for
  git:, gist: and github: dependencies.

ref: ::
  Use the given commit name or SHA for git:, gist: and github:
  dependencies.

branch: ::
  Use the given branch for git:, gist: and github: dependencies.

tag: ::
  Use the given tag for git:, gist: and github: dependencies.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem.name: gem

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_de.description: Returns the basename of the file the dependencies were loaded from
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_de.name: gem_deps_file

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_gi.description:
Handles the git: option from +options+ for gem +name+.

Returns +true+ if the path option was handled.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_gi.name: gem_git

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_gi.description:
Handles a git gem option from +options+ for gem +name+ for a git source
registered through git_source.

Returns +true+ if the custom source option was handled.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_gi.name: gem_git_source

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_gr.description:
Handles the :group and :groups +options+ for the gem with the given
+name+.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_gr.name: gem_group

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_pa.description:
Handles the path: option from +options+ for gem +name+.

Returns +true+ if the path option was handled.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_pa.name: gem_path

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_pl.description:
Handles the platforms: option from +options+.  Returns true if the
platform matches the current platform.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_pl.name: gem_platforms

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_re.description:
Records the require: option from +options+ and adds those files, or the
default file to the require list for +name+.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gem_re.name: gem_requires

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gemspe.description:
:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

Loads dependencies from a gemspec file.

+options+ include:

name: ::
  The name portion of the gemspec file.  Defaults to searching for any
  gemspec file in the current directory.

    gemspec name: 'my_gem'

path: ::
  The path the gemspec lives in.  Defaults to the current directory:

    gemspec 'my_gem', path: 'gemspecs', name: 'my_gem'

development_group: ::
  The group to add development dependencies to.  By default this is
  :development.  Only one group may be specified.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#gemspe.name: gemspec

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#git.description:
:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

Block form for specifying gems from a git +repository+.

  git 'https://github.com/rails/rails.git' do
    gem 'activesupport'
    gem 'activerecord'
  end
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#git.name: git

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#git_se.description: A set of gems that are loaded via the +:git+ option to #gem
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#git_se.name: git_set

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#git_so.description:
Defines a custom git source that uses +name+ to expand git repositories
for use in gems built from git repositories.  You must provide a block
that accepts a git repository name for expansion.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#git_so.name: git_source

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#group.description:
:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

Block form for placing a dependency in the given +groups+.

  group :development do
    gem 'debugger'
  end

  group :development, :test do
    gem 'minitest'
  end

Groups can be excluded at install time using `gem install -g --without
development`.  See `gem help install` and `gem help gem_dependencies` for
further details.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#group.name: group

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#initia.description:
Creates a new GemDependencyAPI that will add dependencies to the
Gem::RequestSet +set+ based on the dependency API description in +path+.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#initia.name: initialize

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#instal.description:
Changes the behavior of gem dependency file loading to installing mode.
In installing mode certain restrictions are ignored such as ruby version
mismatch checks.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#instal.name: installing=

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#load.description: Loads the gem dependency file and returns self.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#load.name: load

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#pin_ge.description:
Pins the gem +name+ to the given +source+.  Adding a gem with the same
name from a different +source+ will raise an exception.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#pin_ge.name: pin_gem_source

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#platfo.description:
:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

Block form for restricting gems to a set of platforms.

The gem dependencies platform is different from Gem::Platform.  A platform
gem.deps.rb platform matches on the ruby engine, the ruby version and
whether or not windows is allowed.

:ruby, :ruby_XY ::
  Matches non-windows, non-jruby implementations where X and Y can be used
  to match releases in the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or 2.1 series.

:mri, :mri_XY ::
  Matches non-windows C Ruby (Matz Ruby) or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or
  2.1 series.

:mingw, :mingw_XY ::
  Matches 32 bit C Ruby on MinGW or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or 2.1 series.

:x64_mingw, :x64_mingw_XY ::
  Matches 64 bit C Ruby on MinGW or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or 2.1 series.

:mswin, :mswin_XY ::
  Matches 32 bit C Ruby on Microsoft Windows or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or
  2.1 series.

:mswin64, :mswin64_XY ::
  Matches 64 bit C Ruby on Microsoft Windows or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or
  2.1 series.

:jruby, :jruby_XY ::
  Matches JRuby or JRuby in 1.8 or 1.9 mode.

:maglev ::
  Matches Maglev

:rbx ::
  Matches non-windows Rubinius

NOTE:  There is inconsistency in what environment a platform matches.  You
may need to read the source to know the exact details.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#platfo.name: platforms

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#platfo.description:
:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

Block form for restricting gems to a set of platforms.

The gem dependencies platform is different from Gem::Platform.  A platform
gem.deps.rb platform matches on the ruby engine, the ruby version and
whether or not windows is allowed.

:ruby, :ruby_XY ::
  Matches non-windows, non-jruby implementations where X and Y can be used
  to match releases in the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or 2.1 series.

:mri, :mri_XY ::
  Matches non-windows C Ruby (Matz Ruby) or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or
  2.1 series.

:mingw, :mingw_XY ::
  Matches 32 bit C Ruby on MinGW or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or 2.1 series.

:x64_mingw, :x64_mingw_XY ::
  Matches 64 bit C Ruby on MinGW or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or 2.1 series.

:mswin, :mswin_XY ::
  Matches 32 bit C Ruby on Microsoft Windows or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or
  2.1 series.

:mswin64, :mswin64_XY ::
  Matches 64 bit C Ruby on Microsoft Windows or only the 1.8, 1.9, 2.0 or
  2.1 series.

:jruby, :jruby_XY ::
  Matches JRuby or JRuby in 1.8 or 1.9 mode.

:maglev ::
  Matches Maglev

:rbx ::
  Matches non-windows Rubinius

NOTE:  There is inconsistency in what environment a platform matches.  You
may need to read the source to know the exact details.

:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

Block form for restricting gems to a particular set of platforms.  See
#platform.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#platfo.name: platforms

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#requir.description: A Hash containing gem names and files to require from those gems.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#requir.name: requires

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#ruby.description:
:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

Restricts this gem dependencies file to the given ruby +version+.

You may also provide +engine:+ and +engine_version:+ options to restrict
this gem dependencies file to a particular ruby engine and its engine
version.  This matching is performed by using the RUBY_ENGINE and
engine_specific VERSION constants.  (For JRuby, JRUBY_VERSION).
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#ruby.name: ruby

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#source.description:
:category: Gem Dependencies DSL

Sets +url+ as a source for gems for this dependency API.  RubyGems uses
the default configured sources if no source was given.  If a source is set
only that source is used.

This method differs in behavior from Bundler:

* The +:gemcutter+, # +:rubygems+ and +:rubyforge+ sources are not
  supported as they are deprecated in bundler.
* The +prepend:+ option is not supported.  If you wish to order sources
  then list them in your preferred order.
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#source.name: source

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#vendor.description: A set of gems that are loaded via the +:path+ option to #gem
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#vendor.name: vendor_set

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#withou.description: The groups of gems to exclude from installation
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#withou.name: without_groups

Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#withou.description: The groups of gems to exclude from installation
Gem::RequestSet::GemDependencyAPI#withou.name: without_groups=

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile.description:
Parses a gem.deps.rb.lock file and constructs a LockSet containing the
dependencies found inside.  If the lock file is missing no LockSet is
constructed.
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile.name: Lockfile

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#get.description: Gets the next token for a Lockfile
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#get.name: get

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#initialize.description:
Creates a new Lockfile for the given +request_set+ and +gem_deps_file+
location.
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#parse_dependen.description:
Parses the requirements following the dependency +name+ and the +op+ for
the first token of the requirements and returns a Gem::Dependency object.
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#parse_dependen.name: parse_dependency

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#peek.description: Peeks at the next token for Lockfile
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#peek.name: peek

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#to_s.description: The contents of the lock file.
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#to_s.name: to_s

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#token_pos.description:
Calculates the column (by byte) and the line of the current token based on
+byte_offset+.
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#token_pos.name: token_pos

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#tokenize.description:
Converts a lock file into an Array of tokens.  If the lock file is missing
an empty Array is returned.
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#tokenize.name: tokenize

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#unget.description: Ungets the last token retrieved by #get
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#unget.name: unget

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#write.description: Writes the lock file alongside the gem dependencies file
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile#write.name: write

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError.description: Raised when a lockfile cannot be parsed
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError.name: ParseError

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError#co.description: The column where the error was encountered
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError#co.name: column

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError#in.description:
Raises a ParseError with the given +message+ which was encountered at a
+line+ and +column+ while parsing.
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError#in.name: initialize

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError#li.description: The line where the error was encountered
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError#li.name: line

Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError#pa.description: The location of the lock file
Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile::ParseError#pa.name: path

Gem::Requirement.description:
A Requirement is a set of one or more version restrictions. It supports a
few (<tt>=, !=, >, <, >=, <=, ~></tt>) different restriction operators.

See Gem::Version for a description on how versions and requirements work
together in RubyGems.
Gem::Requirement.name: Requirement

Gem::Requirement#concat.description: Concatenates the +new+ requirements onto this requirement.
Gem::Requirement#concat.name: concat

Gem::Requirement#exact?.description: true if the requirement is for only an exact version
Gem::Requirement#exact?.name: exact?

Gem::Requirement#for_lockfile.description: Formats this requirement for use in a Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile.
Gem::Requirement#for_lockfile.name: for_lockfile

Gem::Requirement#initialize.description:
Constructs a requirement from +requirements+. Requirements can be
Strings, Gem::Versions, or Arrays of those. +nil+ and duplicate
requirements are ignored. An empty set of +requirements+ is the
same as <tt>">= 0"</tt>.
Gem::Requirement#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Requirement#none?.description: true if this gem has no requirements.
Gem::Requirement#none?.name: none?

Gem::Requirement#prerelease?.description:
A requirement is a prerelease if any of the versions inside of it
are prereleases
Gem::Requirement#prerelease?.name: prerelease?

Gem::Requirement#requirements.description:
An array of requirement pairs. The first element of the pair is
the op, and the second is the Gem::Version.
Gem::Requirement#requirements.name: requirements

Gem::Requirement#specific?.description: True if the requirement will not always match the latest version.
Gem::Requirement#specific?.name: specific?

Gem::Requirement.create.description:
Factory method to create a Gem::Requirement object.  Input may be
a Version, a String, or nil.  Intended to simplify client code.

If the input is "weird", the default version requirement is
returned.
Gem::Requirement.create.name: create

Gem::Requirement.default.description: A default "version requirement" can surely _only_ be '>= 0'.
Gem::Requirement.default.name: default

Gem::Requirement.parse.description:
Parse +obj+, returning an <tt>[op, version]</tt> pair. +obj+ can
be a String or a Gem::Version.

If +obj+ is a String, it can be either a full requirement
specification, like <tt>">= 1.2"</tt>, or a simple version number,
like <tt>"1.2"</tt>.

    parse("> 1.0")                 # => [">", "1.0"]
    parse("1.0")                   # => ["=", "1.0"]
    parse(Gem::Version.new("1.0")) # => ["=,  "1.0"]
Gem::Requirement.parse.name: parse

Gem::Requirement::BadRequirementError.description: Raised when a bad requirement is encountered
Gem::Requirement::BadRequirementError.name: BadRequirementError

Gem::Requirement::DefaultRequirement.description: The default requirement matches any version
Gem::Requirement::DefaultRequirement.name: DefaultRequirement

Gem::Requirement::PATTERN.description: A regular expression that matches a requirement
Gem::Requirement::PATTERN.name: PATTERN

Gem::Resolver.description:
Given a set of Gem::Dependency objects as +needed+ and a way to query the
set of available specs via +set+, calculates a set of ActivationRequest
objects which indicate all the specs that should be activated to meet the
all the requirements.
Gem::Resolver.name: Resolver

Gem::Resolver#activation_request.description:
Creates an ActivationRequest for the given +dep+ and the last +possible+
specification.

Returns the Specification and the ActivationRequest
Gem::Resolver#activation_request.name: activation_request

Gem::Resolver#conflicts.description: Contains all the conflicts encountered while doing resolution
Gem::Resolver#conflicts.name: conflicts

Gem::Resolver#development.description: Set to true if all development dependencies should be considered.
Gem::Resolver#development.name: development

Gem::Resolver#development=.description: Set to true if all development dependencies should be considered.
Gem::Resolver#development=.name: development=

Gem::Resolver#development_shallow.description: Set to true if immediate development dependencies should be considered.
Gem::Resolver#development_shallow.name: development_shallow

Gem::Resolver#development_shallow=.description: Set to true if immediate development dependencies should be considered.
Gem::Resolver#development_shallow=.name: development_shallow=

Gem::Resolver#find_possible.description:
Extracts the specifications that may be able to fulfill +dependency+ and
returns those that match the local platform and all those that match.
Gem::Resolver#find_possible.name: find_possible

Gem::Resolver#ignore_dependencies.description: When true, no dependencies are looked up for requested gems.
Gem::Resolver#ignore_dependencies.name: ignore_dependencies

Gem::Resolver#ignore_dependencies=.description: When true, no dependencies are looked up for requested gems.
Gem::Resolver#ignore_dependencies=.name: ignore_dependencies=

Gem::Resolver#initialize.description:
Create Resolver object which will resolve the tree starting
with +needed+ Dependency objects.

+set+ is an object that provides where to look for specifications to
satisfy the Dependencies. This defaults to IndexSet, which will query
rubygems.org.
Gem::Resolver#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver#missing.description: List of dependencies that could not be found in the configured sources.
Gem::Resolver#missing.name: missing

Gem::Resolver#resolve.description: Proceed with resolution! Returns an array of ActivationRequest objects.
Gem::Resolver#resolve.name: resolve

Gem::Resolver#resolve_for.description:
The meat of the algorithm. Given +needed+ DependencyRequest objects and
+specs+ being a list to ActivationRequest, calculate a new list of
ActivationRequest objects.
Gem::Resolver#resolve_for.name: resolve_for

Gem::Resolver#resolve_for_conflict.description:
Rewinds +needed+ and +specs+ to a previous state in +state+ for a conflict
between +dep+ and +existing+.
Gem::Resolver#resolve_for_conflict.name: resolve_for_conflict

Gem::Resolver#resolve_for_multiple.description:
There are multiple +possible+ specifications for this +dep+.  Updates
+needed+, +specs+ and +states+ for further resolution of the +possible+
choices.
Gem::Resolver#resolve_for_multiple.name: resolve_for_multiple

Gem::Resolver#resolve_for_single.description:
Add the spec from the +possible+ list to +specs+ and process the spec's
dependencies by adding them to +needed+.
Gem::Resolver#resolve_for_single.name: resolve_for_single

Gem::Resolver#resolve_for_zero.description: When there are no possible specifications for +dep+ our work is done.
Gem::Resolver#resolve_for_zero.name: resolve_for_zero

Gem::Resolver#select_local_platforms.description: Returns the gems in +specs+ that match the local platform.
Gem::Resolver#select_local_platforms.name: select_local_platforms

Gem::Resolver#skip_gems.description:
Hash of gems to skip resolution.  Keyed by gem name, with arrays of
gem specifications as values.
Gem::Resolver#skip_gems.name: skip_gems

Gem::Resolver#skip_gems=.description:
Hash of gems to skip resolution.  Keyed by gem name, with arrays of
gem specifications as values.
Gem::Resolver#skip_gems=.name: skip_gems=

Gem::Resolver#soft_missing.description:
When a missing dependency, don't stop. Just go on and record what was
missing.
Gem::Resolver#soft_missing.name: soft_missing

Gem::Resolver#soft_missing=.description:
When a missing dependency, don't stop. Just go on and record what was
missing.
Gem::Resolver#soft_missing=.name: soft_missing=

Gem::Resolver#stats.description: Returns the value of attribute stats
Gem::Resolver#stats.name: stats

Gem::Resolver.compose_sets.description:
Combines +sets+ into a ComposedSet that allows specification lookup in a
uniform manner.  If one of the +sets+ is itself a ComposedSet its sets are
flattened into the result ComposedSet.
Gem::Resolver.compose_sets.name: compose_sets

Gem::Resolver.for_current_gems.description:
Creates a Resolver that queries only against the already installed gems
for the +needed+ dependencies.
Gem::Resolver.for_current_gems.name: for_current_gems

Gem::Resolver::APISet.description:
The global rubygems pool, available via the rubygems.org API.
Returns instances of APISpecification.
Gem::Resolver::APISet.name: APISet

Gem::Resolver::APISet#dep_uri.description: The URI for the dependency API this APISet uses.
Gem::Resolver::APISet#dep_uri.name: dep_uri

Gem::Resolver::APISet#find_all.description:
Return an array of APISpecification objects matching
DependencyRequest +req+.
Gem::Resolver::APISet#find_all.name: find_all

Gem::Resolver::APISet#initialize.description:
Creates a new APISet that will retrieve gems from +uri+ using the RubyGems
API URL +dep_uri+ which is described at
http://guides.rubygems.org/rubygems-org-api
Gem::Resolver::APISet#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::APISet#prefetch.description:
A hint run by the resolver to allow the Set to fetch
data for DependencyRequests +reqs+.
Gem::Resolver::APISet#prefetch.name: prefetch

Gem::Resolver::APISet#source.description: The Gem::Source that gems are fetched from
Gem::Resolver::APISet#source.name: source

Gem::Resolver::APISet#uri.description: The corresponding place to fetch gems.
Gem::Resolver::APISet#uri.name: uri

Gem::Resolver::APISet#versions.description: Return data for all versions of the gem +name+.
Gem::Resolver::APISet#versions.name: versions

Gem::Resolver::APISpecification.description:
Represents a specification retrieved via the rubygems.org API.

This is used to avoid loading the full Specification object when all we need
is the name, version, and dependencies.
Gem::Resolver::APISpecification.name: APISpecification

Gem::Resolver::APISpecification#initiali.description:
Creates an APISpecification for the given +set+ from the rubygems.org
+api_data+.

See http://guides.rubygems.org/rubygems-org-api/#misc_methods for the
format of the +api_data+.
Gem::Resolver::APISpecification#initiali.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::APISpecification#spec.description: Fetches a Gem::Specification for this APISpecification.
Gem::Resolver::APISpecification#spec.name: spec

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest.description:
Specifies a Specification object that should be activated.  Also contains a
dependency that was used to introduce this activation.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest.name: ActivationRequest

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#develop.description: Is this activation request for a development dependency?
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#develop.name: development?

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#downloa.description: Downloads a gem at +path+ and returns the file path.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#downloa.name: download

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#full_na.description: The full name of the specification to be activated.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#full_na.name: full_name

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#full_sp.description: The Gem::Specification for this activation request.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#full_sp.name: full_spec

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#initial.description:
Creates a new ActivationRequest that will activate +spec+.  The parent
+request+ is used to provide diagnostics in case of conflicts.

+others_possible+ indicates that other specifications may also match this
activation request.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#initial.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#install.description: True if the requested gem has already been installed.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#install.name: installed?

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#name.description: The name of this activation request's specification
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#name.name: name

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#others_.description:
Indicate if this activation is one of a set of possible
requests for the same Dependency request.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#others_.name: others_possible?

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#parent.description:
Return the ActivationRequest that contained the dependency
that we were activated for.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#parent.name: parent

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#request.description: The parent request for this activation request.
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#request.name: request

Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#version.description: The version of this activation request's specification
Gem::Resolver::ActivationRequest#version.name: version

Gem::Resolver::BestSet.description:
The BestSet chooses the best available method to query a remote index.

It combines IndexSet and APISet
Gem::Resolver::BestSet.name: BestSet

Gem::Resolver::BestSet#initialize.description:
Creates a BestSet for the given +sources+ or Gem::sources if none are
specified.  +sources+ must be a Gem::SourceList.
Gem::Resolver::BestSet#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::BestSet#pick_sets.description: Picks which sets to use for the configured sources.
Gem::Resolver::BestSet#pick_sets.name: pick_sets

Gem::Resolver::BestSet#replace_failed_ap.description:
Replaces a failed APISet for the URI in +error+ with an IndexSet.

If no matching APISet can be found the original +error+ is raised.

The calling method must retry the exception to repeat the lookup.
Gem::Resolver::BestSet#replace_failed_ap.name: replace_failed_api_set

Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet.description:
A ComposedSet allows multiple sets to be queried like a single set.

To create a composed set with any number of sets use:

  Gem::Resolver.compose_sets set1, set2

This method will eliminate nesting of composed sets.
Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet.name: ComposedSet

Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet#find_all.description: Finds all specs matching +req+ in all sets.
Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet#find_all.name: find_all

Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet#initialize.description:
Creates a new ComposedSet containing +sets+.  Use
Gem::Resolver::compose_sets instead.
Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet#prerelease=.description:
When +allow_prerelease+ is set to +true+ prereleases gems are allowed to
match dependencies.
Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet#prerelease=.name: prerelease=

Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet#remote=.description: Sets the remote network access for all composed sets.
Gem::Resolver::ComposedSet#remote=.name: remote=

Gem::Resolver::Conflict.description:
Used internally to indicate that a dependency conflicted
with a spec that would be activated.
Gem::Resolver::Conflict.name: Conflict

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#activated.description: The specification that was activated prior to the conflict
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#activated.name: activated

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#conflicting_depe.description: Return the 2 dependency objects that conflicted
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#conflicting_depe.name: conflicting_dependencies

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#dependency.description: The dependency that is in conflict with the activated gem.
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#dependency.name: dependency

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#explain.description: A string explanation of the conflict.
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#explain.name: explain

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#explanation.description: Explanation of the conflict used by exceptions to print useful messages
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#explanation.name: explanation

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#for_spec?.description: Returns true if the conflicting dependency's name matches +spec+.
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#for_spec?.name: for_spec?

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#initialize.description:
Creates a new resolver conflict when +dependency+ is in conflict with an
already +activated+ specification.
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#request_path.description: Path of activations from the +current+ list.
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#request_path.name: request_path

Gem::Resolver::Conflict#requester.description: Return the Specification that listed the dependency
Gem::Resolver::Conflict#requester.name: requester

Gem::Resolver::CurrentSet.description:
A set which represents the installed gems. Respects
all the normal settings that control where to look
for installed gems.
Gem::Resolver::CurrentSet.name: CurrentSet

Gem::Resolver::DEBUG_RESOLVER.description:
If the DEBUG_RESOLVER environment variable is set then debugging mode is
enabled for the resolver.  This will display information about the state
of the resolver while a set of dependencies is being resolved.
Gem::Resolver::DEBUG_RESOLVER.name: DEBUG_RESOLVER

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest.description:
Used Internally. Wraps a Dependency object to also track which spec
contained the Dependency.
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest.name: DependencyRequest

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#develop.description: Is this dependency a development dependency?
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#develop.name: development?

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#explici.description: Indicate that the request is for a gem explicitly requested by the user
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#explici.name: explicit?

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#implici.description:
Indicate that the request is for a gem requested as a dependency of
another gem
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#implici.name: implicit?

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#initial.description:
Creates a new DependencyRequest for +dependency+ from +requester+.
+requester may be nil if the request came from a user.
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#initial.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#match?.description:
Does this dependency request match +spec+?

NOTE:  #match? only matches prerelease versions when #dependency is a
prerelease dependency.
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#match?.name: match?

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#matches.description:
Does this dependency request match +spec+?

NOTE:  #matches_spec? matches prerelease versions.  See also #match?
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#matches.name: matches_spec?

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#name.description: The name of the gem this dependency request is requesting.
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#name.name: name

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#request.description:
Return a String indicating who caused this request to be added (only
valid for implicit requests)
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#request.name: request_context

Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#require.description: The version requirement for this dependency request
Gem::Resolver::DependencyRequest#require.name: requirement

Gem::Resolver::GitSet.description:
A GitSet represents gems that are sourced from git repositories.

This is used for gem dependency file support.

Example:

  set = Gem::Resolver::GitSet.new
  set.add_git_gem 'rake', 'git://example/rake.git', tag: 'rake-10.1.0'
Gem::Resolver::GitSet.name: GitSet

Gem::Resolver::GitSet#add_git_spec.description:
Adds and returns a GitSpecification with the given +name+ and +version+
which came from a +repository+ at the given +reference+.  If +submodules+
is true they are checked out along with the repository.

This fills in the prefetch information as enough information about the gem
is present in the arguments.
Gem::Resolver::GitSet#add_git_spec.name: add_git_spec

Gem::Resolver::GitSet#prefetch.description: Prefetches specifications from the git repositories in this set.
Gem::Resolver::GitSet#prefetch.name: prefetch

Gem::Resolver::GitSet#repositories.description:
A Hash containing git gem names for keys and a Hash of repository and
git commit reference as values.
Gem::Resolver::GitSet#repositories.name: repositories

Gem::Resolver::GitSet#root_dir.description:
The root directory for git gems in this set.  This is usually Gem.dir, the
installation directory for regular gems.
Gem::Resolver::GitSet#root_dir.name: root_dir

Gem::Resolver::GitSet#root_dir=.description:
The root directory for git gems in this set.  This is usually Gem.dir, the
installation directory for regular gems.
Gem::Resolver::GitSet#root_dir=.name: root_dir=

Gem::Resolver::GitSet#specs.description: A hash of gem names to Gem::Resolver::GitSpecifications
Gem::Resolver::GitSet#specs.name: specs

Gem::Resolver::GitSpecification.description:
A GitSpecification represents a gem that is sourced from a git repository
and is being loaded through a gem dependencies file through the +git:+
option.
Gem::Resolver::GitSpecification.name: GitSpecification

Gem::Resolver::GitSpecification#install.description:
Installing a git gem only involves building the extensions and generating
the executables.
Gem::Resolver::GitSpecification#install.name: install

Gem::Resolver::IndexSet.description:
The global rubygems pool represented via the traditional
source index.
Gem::Resolver::IndexSet.name: IndexSet

Gem::Resolver::IndexSet#find_all.description:
Return an array of IndexSpecification objects matching
DependencyRequest +req+.
Gem::Resolver::IndexSet#find_all.name: find_all

Gem::Resolver::IndexSpecification.description:
Represents a possible Specification object returned from IndexSet.  Used to
delay needed to download full Specification objects when only the +name+
and +version+ are needed.
Gem::Resolver::IndexSpecification.name: IndexSpecification

Gem::Resolver::IndexSpecification#depend.description: The dependencies of the gem for this specification
Gem::Resolver::IndexSpecification#depend.name: dependencies

Gem::Resolver::IndexSpecification#initia.description:
An IndexSpecification is created from the index format described in `gem
help generate_index`.

The +set+ contains other specifications for this (URL) +source+.

The +name+, +version+ and +platform+ are the name, version and platform of
the gem.
Gem::Resolver::IndexSpecification#initia.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::IndexSpecification#spec.description: Fetches a Gem::Specification for this IndexSpecification from the #source.
Gem::Resolver::IndexSpecification#spec.name: spec

Gem::Resolver::InstalledSpecification.description:
An InstalledSpecification represents a gem that is already installed
locally.
Gem::Resolver::InstalledSpecification.name: InstalledSpecification

Gem::Resolver::InstalledSpecification#in.description:
This is a null install as this specification is already installed.
+options+ are ignored.
Gem::Resolver::InstalledSpecification#in.name: install

Gem::Resolver::InstalledSpecification#in.description: Returns +true+ if this gem is installable for the current platform.
Gem::Resolver::InstalledSpecification#in.name: installable_platform?

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet.description:
A set of gems for installation sourced from remote sources and local .gem
files
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet.name: InstallerSet

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#add_always_i.description:
Looks up the latest specification for +dependency+ and adds it to the
always_install list.
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#add_always_i.name: add_always_install

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#add_local.description:
Adds a local gem requested using +dep_name+ with the given +spec+ that can
be loaded and installed using the +source+.
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#add_local.name: add_local

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#always_insta.description: List of Gem::Specification objects that must always be installed.
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#always_insta.name: always_install

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#consider_loc.description: Should local gems should be considered?
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#consider_loc.name: consider_local?

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#consider_rem.description: Should remote gems should be considered?
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#consider_rem.name: consider_remote?

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#find_all.description:
Returns an array of IndexSpecification objects matching DependencyRequest
+req+.
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#find_all.name: find_all

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#ignore_depen.description: Only install gems in the always_install list
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#ignore_depen.name: ignore_dependencies

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#ignore_depen.description: Only install gems in the always_install list
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#ignore_depen.name: ignore_dependencies=

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#ignore_insta.description:
Do not look in the installed set when finding specifications.  This is
used by the --install-dir option to `gem install`
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#ignore_insta.name: ignore_installed

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#ignore_insta.description:
Do not look in the installed set when finding specifications.  This is
used by the --install-dir option to `gem install`
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#ignore_insta.name: ignore_installed=

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#initialize.description: Creates a new InstallerSet that will look for gems in +domain+.
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#load_spec.description:
Called from IndexSpecification to get a true Specification
object.
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#load_spec.name: load_spec

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#local?.description: Has a local gem for +dep_name+ been added to this set?
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#local?.name: local?

Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#remote_set.description: The remote_set looks up remote gems for installation.
Gem::Resolver::InstallerSet#remote_set.name: remote_set

Gem::Resolver::LocalSpecification.description: A LocalSpecification comes from a .gem file on the local filesystem.
Gem::Resolver::LocalSpecification.name: LocalSpecification

Gem::Resolver::LocalSpecification#instal.description: Returns +true+ if this gem is installable for the current platform.
Gem::Resolver::LocalSpecification#instal.name: installable_platform?

Gem::Resolver::LockSet.description: A set of gems from a gem dependencies lockfile.
Gem::Resolver::LockSet.name: LockSet

Gem::Resolver::LockSet#add.description:
Creates a new IndexSpecification in this set using the given +name+,
+version+ and +platform+.

The specification's set will be the current set, and the source will be
the current set's source.
Gem::Resolver::LockSet#add.name: add

Gem::Resolver::LockSet#find_all.description:
Returns an Array of IndexSpecification objects matching the
DependencyRequest +req+.
Gem::Resolver::LockSet#find_all.name: find_all

Gem::Resolver::LockSet#initialize.description: Creates a new LockSet from the given +sources+
Gem::Resolver::LockSet#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::LockSet#load_spec.description:
Loads a Gem::Specification with the given +name+, +version+ and
+platform+.  +source+ is ignored.
Gem::Resolver::LockSet#load_spec.name: load_spec

Gem::Resolver::LockSpecification.description:
The LockSpecification comes from a lockfile (Gem::RequestSet::Lockfile).

A LockSpecification's dependency information is pre-filled from the
lockfile.
Gem::Resolver::LockSpecification.name: LockSpecification

Gem::Resolver::LockSpecification#add_dep.description: Adds +dependency+ from the lockfile to this specification
Gem::Resolver::LockSpecification#add_dep.name: add_dependency

Gem::Resolver::LockSpecification#install.description:
This is a null install as a locked specification is considered installed.
+options+ are ignored.
Gem::Resolver::LockSpecification#install.name: install

Gem::Resolver::LockSpecification#spec.description: A specification constructed from the lockfile is returned
Gem::Resolver::LockSpecification#spec.name: spec

Gem::Resolver::RequirementList.description:
The RequirementList is used to hold the requirements being considered
while resolving a set of gems.

The RequirementList acts like a queue where the oldest items are removed
first.
Gem::Resolver::RequirementList.name: RequirementList

Gem::Resolver::RequirementList#add.description: Adds Resolver::DependencyRequest +req+ to this requirements list.
Gem::Resolver::RequirementList#add.name: add

Gem::Resolver::RequirementList#next5.description: Returns the oldest five entries from the list.
Gem::Resolver::RequirementList#next5.name: next5

Gem::Resolver::RequirementList#remove.description: Remove the oldest DependencyRequest from the list.
Gem::Resolver::RequirementList#remove.name: remove

Gem::Resolver::RequirementList#size.description: How many elements are in the list
Gem::Resolver::RequirementList#size.name: size

Gem::Resolver::Set.description:
Resolver sets are used to look up specifications (and their
dependencies) used in resolution.  This set is abstract.
Gem::Resolver::Set.name: Set

Gem::Resolver::Set#find_all.description:
The find_all method must be implemented.  It returns all Resolver
Specification objects matching the given DependencyRequest +req+.
Gem::Resolver::Set#find_all.name: find_all

Gem::Resolver::Set#prefetch.description:
The #prefetch method may be overridden, but this is not necessary.  This
default implementation does nothing, which is suitable for sets where
looking up a specification is cheap (such as installed gems).

When overridden, the #prefetch method should look up specifications
matching +reqs+.
Gem::Resolver::Set#prefetch.name: prefetch

Gem::Resolver::Set#prerelease.description: When true, allows matching of requests to prerelease gems.
Gem::Resolver::Set#prerelease.name: prerelease

Gem::Resolver::Set#prerelease=.description: When true, allows matching of requests to prerelease gems.
Gem::Resolver::Set#prerelease=.name: prerelease=

Gem::Resolver::Set#remote.description: Set to true to disable network access for this set
Gem::Resolver::Set#remote.name: remote

Gem::Resolver::Set#remote=.description: Set to true to disable network access for this set
Gem::Resolver::Set#remote=.name: remote=

Gem::Resolver::Set#remote?.description:
When true, this set is allowed to access the network when looking up
specifications or dependencies.
Gem::Resolver::Set#remote?.name: remote?

Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification.description:
The Resolver::SpecSpecification contains common functionality for
Resolver specifications that are backed by a Gem::Specification.
Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification.name: SpecSpecification

Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#depende.description: The dependencies of the gem for this specification
Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#depende.name: dependencies

Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#full_na.description:
The name and version of the specification.

Unlike Gem::Specification#full_name, the platform is not included.
Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#full_na.name: full_name

Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#initial.description:
A SpecSpecification is created for a +set+ for a Gem::Specification in
+spec+.  The +source+ is either where the +spec+ came from, or should be
loaded from.
Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#initial.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#name.description: The name of the gem for this specification
Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#name.name: name

Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#platfor.description: The platform this gem works on.
Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#platfor.name: platform

Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#version.description: The version of the gem for this specification.
Gem::Resolver::SpecSpecification#version.name: version

Gem::Resolver::Specification.description:
A Resolver::Specification contains a subset of the information
contained in a Gem::Specification.  Only the information necessary for
dependency resolution in the resolver is included.
Gem::Resolver::Specification.name: Specification

Gem::Resolver::Specification#dependencie.description: The dependencies of the gem for this specification
Gem::Resolver::Specification#dependencie.name: dependencies

Gem::Resolver::Specification#fetch_devel.description:
Fetches development dependencies if the source does not provide them by
default (see APISpecification).
Gem::Resolver::Specification#fetch_devel.name: fetch_development_dependencies

Gem::Resolver::Specification#full_name.description:
The name and version of the specification.

Unlike Gem::Specification#full_name, the platform is not included.
Gem::Resolver::Specification#full_name.name: full_name

Gem::Resolver::Specification#initialize.description: Sets default instance variables for the specification.
Gem::Resolver::Specification#initialize.name: initialize

Gem::Resolver::Specification#install.description:
Installs this specification using the Gem::Installer +options+.  The
install method yields a Gem::Installer instance, which indicates the
gem will be installed, or +nil+, which indicates the gem is already
installed.

After installation #spec is updated to point to the just-installed
specification.
Gem::Resolver::Specification#install.name: install

Gem::Resolver::Specification#installable.description: Returns true if this specification is installable on this platform.
Gem::Resolver::Specification#installable.name: installable_platform?

Gem::Resolver::Specification#name.description: The name of the gem for this specification
Gem::Resolver::Specification#name.name: name

Gem::Resolver::Specification#platform.description: The platform this gem works on.
Gem::Resolver::Specification#platform.name: platform

Gem::Resolver::Specification#set.description: The set this specification came from.
Gem::Resolver::Specification#set.name: set

Gem::Resolver::Specification#spec.description:
The Gem::Specification for this Resolver::Specification.

Implementers, note that #install updates @spec, so be sure to cache the
Gem::Specification in @spec when overriding.
Gem::Resolver::Specification#spec.name: spec

Gem::Resolver::Specification#version.description: The version of the gem for this specification.
Gem::Resolver::Specification#version.name: version

Gem::Resolver::State.description:
Contains the state for attempting activation of a set of possible specs.
+needed+ is a Gem::List of DependencyRequest objects that, well, need
to be satisfied.
+specs+ is the List of ActivationRequest that are being tested.
+dep+ is the DependencyRequest that was used to generate this state.
+spec+ is the Specification for this state.
+possible+ is List of DependencyRequest objects that can be tried to
find a  complete set.
+conflicts+ is a [DependencyRequest, Conflict] hit tried to
activate the state.
Gem::Resolver::State.name: State

Gem::Resolver::State#conflicts.description: Returns the value of attribute conflicts
Gem::Resolver::State#conflicts.name: conflicts

Gem::Resolver::State#conflicts=.name: conflicts=
parameters: the value to set the attribute conflicts to.

Gem::Resolver::State#dep.description: Returns the value of attribute dep
Gem::Resolver::State#dep.name: dep

Gem::Resolver::State#dep=.name: dep=
parameters: the value to set the attribute dep to.

Gem::Resolver::State#needed.description: Returns the value of attribute needed
Gem::Resolver::State#needed.name: needed

Gem::Resolver::State#needed=.name: needed=
parameters: the value to set the attribute needed to.

Gem::Resolver::State#possibles.description: Returns the value of attribute possibles
Gem::Resolver::State#possibles.name: possibles

Gem::Resolver::State#possibles=.name: possibles=
parameters: the value to set the attribute possibles to.

Gem::Resolver::State#spec.description: Returns the value of attribute spec
Gem::Resolver::State#spec.name: spec

Gem::Resolver::State#spec=.name: spec=
parameters: the value to set the attribute spec to.

Gem::Resolver::State#specs.description: Returns the value of attribute specs
Gem::Resolver::State#specs.name: specs

Gem::Resolver::State#specs=.name: specs=
parameters: the value to set the attribute specs to.

Gem::Resolver::VendorSet.description:
A VendorSet represents gems that have been unpacked into a specific
directory that contains a gemspec.

This is used for gem dependency file support.

Example:

  set = Gem::Resolver::VendorSet.new

  set.add_vendor_gem 'rake', 'vendor/rake'

The directory vendor/rake must contain an unpacked rake gem along with a
rake.gemspec (watching the given name).
Gem::Resolver::VendorSet.name: VendorSet

Gem::Resolver::VendorSet#add_vendor_gem.description:
Adds a specification to the set with the given +name+ which has been
unpacked into the given +directory+.
Gem::Resolver::VendorSet#add_vendor_gem.name: add_vendor_gem

Gem::Resolver::VendorSet#find_all.description:
Returns an Array of VendorSpecification objects matching the
DependencyRequest +req+.
Gem::Resolver::VendorSet#find_all.name: find_all

Gem::Resolver::VendorSet#load_spec.description:
Loads a spec with the given +name+. +version+, +platform+ and +source+ are
ignored.
Gem::Resolver::VendorSet#load_spec.name: load_spec

Gem::Security.create_cert.description:
Creates an unsigned certificate for +subject+ and +key+.  The lifetime of
the key is from the current time to +age+ which defaults to one year.

The +extensions+ restrict the key to the indicated uses.
Gem::Security.create_cert.name: create_cert

Gem::Security.create_cert_email.description:
Creates a self-signed certificate with an issuer and subject from +email+,
a subject alternative name of +email+ and the given +extensions+ for the
+key+.

Gem::Security.create_cert_self_signed.description:
Creates a self-signed certificate with an issuer and subject of +subject+
and the given +extensions+ for the +key+.
Gem::Security.create_cert_self_signed.name: create_cert_self_signed

Gem::Security.create_key.description:
Creates a new key pair of the specified +length+ and +algorithm+.  The
default is a 2048 bit RSA key.
Gem::Security.create_key.name: create_key

Gem::Security.re_sign.description:
Signs +expired_certificate+ with +private_key+ if the keys match and the
expired certificate was self-signed.

Gem::Security.reset.description: Resets the trust directory for verifying gems.

Gem::Security.sign.description:
Sign the public key from +certificate+ with the +signing_key+ and
+signing_cert+, using the Gem::Security::DIGEST_ALGORITHM.  Uses the
default certificate validity range and extensions.

Returns the newly signed certificate.

Gem::Security.trust_dir.description:
Returns a Gem::Security::TrustDir which wraps the directory where trusted
certificates live.

Gem::Security.trusted_certificates.name: trusted_certificates

Writes +pemmable+, which must respond to +to_pem+ to +path+ with the given
+permissions+. If passed +cipher+ and +passphrase+ those arguments will be
passed to +to_pem+.
Gem::Security.write.name: write

Gem::Security::AlmostNoSecurity.description:
AlmostNo security policy: only verify that the signing certificate is the
one that actually signed the data.  Make no attempt to verify the signing
certificate chain.

This policy is basically useless. better than nothing, but can still be
easily spoofed, and is not recommended.
Gem::Security::AlmostNoSecurity.name: AlmostNoSecurity

Gem::Security::DIGEST_ALGORITHM.description: Digest algorithm used to sign gems
Gem::Security::DIGEST_ALGORITHM.name: DIGEST_ALGORITHM

Gem::Security::DIGEST_NAME.description: Used internally to select the signing digest from all computed digests
Gem::Security::DIGEST_NAME.name: DIGEST_NAME

Gem::Security::EXTENSIONS.description:
The default set of extensions are:

* The certificate is not a certificate authority
* The key for the certificate may be used for key and data encipherment
  and digital signatures
* The certificate contains a subject key identifier
Gem::Security::EXTENSIONS.name: EXTENSIONS

Gem::Security::HighSecurity.description:
High security policy: only allow signed gems to be installed, verify the
signing certificate, verify the signing certificate chain all the way to
the root certificate, and only trust root certificates that we have
explicitly allowed trust for.

This security policy is significantly more difficult to bypass, and offers
a reasonable guarantee that the contents of the gem have not been altered.
Gem::Security::HighSecurity.name: HighSecurity

Gem::Security::KEY_ALGORITHM.description: Algorithm for creating the key pair used to sign gems
Gem::Security::KEY_ALGORITHM.name: KEY_ALGORITHM

Gem::Security::KEY_CIPHER.description:
Cipher used to encrypt the key pair used to sign gems.
Must be in the list returned by OpenSSL::Cipher.ciphers
Gem::Security::KEY_CIPHER.name: KEY_CIPHER

Gem::Security::KEY_LENGTH.description: Length of keys created by KEY_ALGORITHM
Gem::Security::KEY_LENGTH.name: KEY_LENGTH

Gem::Security::LowSecurity.description:
Low security policy: only verify that the signing certificate is actually
the gem signer, and that the signing certificate is valid.

This policy is better than nothing, but can still be easily spoofed, and
is not recommended.
Gem::Security::LowSecurity.name: LowSecurity

Gem::Security::MediumSecurity.description:
Medium security policy: verify the signing certificate, verify the signing
certificate chain all the way to the root certificate, and only trust root
certificates that we have explicitly allowed trust for.

This security policy is reasonable, but it allows unsigned packages, so a
malicious person could simply delete the package signature and pass the
gem off as unsigned.
Gem::Security::MediumSecurity.name: MediumSecurity

Gem::Security::NoSecurity.description: No security policy: all package signature checks are disabled.
Gem::Security::NoSecurity.name: NoSecurity

Gem::Security::Policy#check_root.description:

Gem::Security::Policy#check_trust.description:
Ensures the root of +chain+ has a trusted certificate in +trust_dir+ and
the digests of the two certificates match according to +digester+
Gem::Security::Policy#check_trust.name: check_trust

Gem::Security::Signer#re_sign_key.description:
Attempts to re-sign the private key if the signing certificate is expired.

The key will be re-signed if:
* The expired certificate is self-signed
* The expired certificate is saved at ~/.gem/gem-public_cert.pem
* There is no file matching the expiry date at
  ~/.gem/gem-public_cert.pem.expired.%Y%m%d%H%M%S

If the signing certificate can be re-signed the expired certificate will
be saved as ~/.gem/gem-pubilc_cert.pem.expired.%Y%m%d%H%M%S where the
expiry time (not after) is used for the timestamp.

Gem::Server.description:
Gem::Server and allows users to serve gems for consumption by
`gem --remote-install`.

gem_server starts an HTTP server on the given port and serves the following:
* "/" - Browsing of gem spec files for installed gems
* "/specs.#{Gem.marshal_version}.gz" - specs name/version/platform index
* "/latest_specs.#{Gem.marshal_version}.gz" - latest specs
  name/version/platform index
* "/quick/" - Individual gemspecs
* "/gems" - Direct access to download the installable gems
* "/rdoc?q=" - Search for installed rdoc documentation

== Usage

  gem_server = Gem::Server.new Gem.dir, 8089, false
  gem_server.run

--
TODO Refactor into a real WEBrick servlet to remove code duplication.
Gem::Server.name: Server

Gem::Server#listen.description:
Creates server sockets based on the addresses option.  If no addresses
were given a server socket for all interfaces is created.
Gem::Server#listen.name: listen

Gem::Server#rdoc.description:
Can be used for quick navigation to the rdoc documentation.  You can then
define a search shortcut for your browser.  E.g. in Firefox connect
'shortcut:rdoc' to http://localhost:8808/rdoc?q=%s template. Then you can
directly open the ActionPack documentation by typing 'rdoc actionp'. If
there are multiple hits for the search term, they are presented as a list
with links.

Search algorithm aims for an intuitive search:
1. first try to find the gems and documentation folders which name
   starts with the search term
2. search for entries, that *contain* the search term
3. show all the gems

If there is only one search hit, user is immediately redirected to the
documentation for the particular gem, otherwise a list with results is
shown.

=== Additional trick - install documentation for Ruby core

Note: please adjust paths accordingly use for example 'locate yaml.rb' and
'gem environment' to identify directories, that are specific for your
local installation

1. install Ruby sources
     cd /usr/src
     sudo apt-get source ruby

2. generate documentation
     rdoc -o /usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/doc/core/rdoc \
       /usr/lib/ruby/1.8 ruby1.8-1.8.7.72

By typing 'rdoc core' you can now access the core documentation
Gem::Server#rdoc.name: rdoc

Gem::Server#reset_gems.description: Updates the server to use the latest installed gems.
Gem::Server#reset_gems.name: reset_gems

Gem::Server#show_rdoc_for_pattern.description:
Returns true and prepares http response, if rdoc for the requested gem
name pattern was found.

The search is based on the file system content, not on the gems metadata.
This allows additional documentation folders like 'core' for the Ruby core
documentation - just put it underneath the main doc folder.
Gem::Server#show_rdoc_for_pattern.name: show_rdoc_for_pattern
